an10.168:4.1: “Mendicants, I will teach you the noble descent.
an10.168:4.2: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
an10.168:5.1: “And what, mendicants, is the noble descent?
an10.168:5.2: It’s when a noble disciple reflects:
an10.168:5.3: ‘Killing living creatures has a bad result
an10.168:5.4: in the present life and in lives to come.’
an10.168:5.5: Reflecting like this, they give up killing living creatures,
an10.168:5.6: they descend from killing living creatures.
an10.168:6.2: in the present life and in lives to come.’
an10.168:6.3: Reflecting like this, they give up stealing,
an10.168:14.1: … ‘Wrong view has a bad result both in the present life and in lives to come.’
an10.168:14.2: Reflecting like this, they give up wrong view,
an10.168:14.4: This is called the noble descent.”
